name: David Fernández

projects.title: Shuvani
projects.headline: A dual-stick isometric roguelite built using Unreal Engine 4
projects.description: I collaborated with more than 35 people, from different fields of knowledge, to develop an original title as a part of my master's degree final project. Mainly I worked as a gameplay and tools programmer, tackling the more combat-oriented aspects of the game. I implemented the player controller, together with an aim assist system, as well as the functionality and toolset used to create all the abilities used both by the main player and the enemies.

projects.title: Robot Rush
projects.headline: Fun little 3D arcade bullet hell game made entirely with OpenGL and C++
projects.description: I built and put together a little mini-game from scratch using only C++ and OpenGL, together with all the necessary libraries used for loading assets such as meshes, textures or sounds. In this project I had to deal with the nuances of capturing both mouse and keyboard input, handling collisions, keeping track of my own deltaTime to handle the simulation and even developing custom shaders for specific components. Feel free to check out a little video by clicking on the banner.

services.title: Art Direction
services.description: We help with the creation and development of online advertising ideas, with particular focus on their visual appearance.

aboutpara:
Hi there! I'm David, a full-stack Sofware Engineer and a junior Game Developer. I've been developing different kinds of user-oriented software since 2016, when I stumbled upon coding tutorials and Unity (which back then seemed like absolute black magic). Currently, as a part of my master's degree, I'm working on Shuvani, a completely original title. 
I've always been a very curious and creative individual which is why I was quickly drawn towards the more artistic fields of computer engineering, ultimately ending up in the video game industry. Honestly, I should've seen it coming.
